result.execSummary:
The defendant Deborah M Bair was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 76 days credit, if revoked.
The Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Fine ($1519) is to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs ($35) to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Village of Menomonee Falls Police Department and DNA surcharge of ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours with Standard Release Conditions, including doctor's appointment for herself and children, school, work and treatment - commencing forthwith.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Leslie Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Deborah M Bair in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.   

Defendant pleads No Contest to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count1.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant's daughter presented a statement to the court.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison: 4 Years
Initial Confinement: 2 Years
Extended Supervision: 2 Years
76 Days Credit
Stayed

If Revoked:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 


36  Months D/L REVOCATION
36  Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

Term of Probation:  3  Years.
Conditions of Probation:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $60 (to be forward to Village of Menomonee Falls Police Department);
FINE:  $1519
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
7 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber 
(all standard release conditions, including doctor's appointment for herself and children, school, work and treatment)
Defendant to be transferred - Forthwith

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 8, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Exhibit #1 From Preliminary Hearing held on 10/06/14.

Defendant Deborah M Bair in court, in custody, with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Brian W. from the Village of Meonomnee Falls was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State presents exhibit #1 marked and received. State rest. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense moves to dismiss and presents arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail to also be addressed at the next hearing.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 6, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
